de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.sortable

Interface SortableListAdapter<DataType>

  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the adapter's underlying data
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ListAdapter<DataType>, MultipleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, NoChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, SelectableListAdapter<DataType>, SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnableStateListAdapter, AbstractFilterableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateListAdapter, AbstractListAdapter, AbstractSelectableListAdapter, AbstractSortableListAdapter, MultipleChoiceListAdapterImplementation, NoChoiceListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation

    public interface SortableListAdapter<DataType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a sortable list of arbitrary items, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a AbsListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        void sort()
        Sorts the adapter's items in an ascending order. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.

      • sort

        void sort(@NonNull
          Order order)
        Sorts the adapter's items in a specific order. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • sort

        void sort(@Nullable
          java.util.Comparator<DataType> comparator)
        Sorts the adapter's items in an ascending order, by using a comparator.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used

      • sort

        void sort(@NonNull
          Order order,
          @Nullable
          java.util.Comparator<DataType> comparator)
        Sorts the adapter's items in a specific order, by using a comparator.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • addItemSorted

        int addItemSorted(@NonNull
                  DataType item)
        Adds a specific item to the adapter. If the adapter's items are currently sorted, the item will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, it will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null
        Returns:
        The index of the the item, which has been added to the adapter, as an Integer value or -1, if the item has not been added

      • addItemSorted

        int addItemSorted(@NonNull
                  DataType item,
                  @Nullable
                  java.util.Comparator<DataType> comparator)
        Adds a specific item to the adapter. If the adapter's items are currently sorted, the item will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, it will be added at the end.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the generic type DataType. The item may not be null
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used
        Returns:
        The index of the the item, which has been added to the adapter, as an Integer value or -1, if the item has not been added

      • addAllItemsSorted

        boolean addAllItemsSorted(@NonNull
                          java.util.Collection<? extends DataType> items)
        Adds all items, which are contained by a specific collection, to the adapter. If the adapter's items are currently sorted, the items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        items - The collection, which contains the items, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no items should be added
        Returns:
        True, if all items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllItemsSorted

        boolean addAllItemsSorted(@NonNull
                          java.util.Collection<? extends DataType> items,
                          @Nullable
                          java.util.Comparator<DataType> comparator)
        Adds all items, which are contained by a specific collection, to the adapter. If the adapter's items are currently sorted, the items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end.
        Parameters:
        items - The collection, which contains the items, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no items should be added
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used
        Returns:
        True, if all items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllItemsSorted

        boolean addAllItemsSorted(@NonNull
                          DataType... items)
        Adds all items, which are contained by a specific array, to the adapter. If the adapter's items are currently sorted, the items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        items - The array, which contains the items, which should be added to the adapter, as an array of the generic type DataType or an empty array, if no items should be added
        Returns:
        True, if all items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllItemsSorted

        boolean addAllItemsSorted(@Nullable
                          java.util.Comparator<DataType> comparator,
                          @NonNull
                          DataType... items)
        Adds all items, which are contained by a specific array, to the adapter. If the adapter's items are currently sorted, the items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used
        items - The array, which contains the items, which should be added to the adapter, as an array of the generic type DataType or an empty array, if no items should be added
        Returns:
        True, if all items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • getOrder

        Order getOrder()
        Returns the current order of the adapter's items.
        Returns:
        The current order of the adapter's items as a value of the enum Order or null, if the adapter's items have not been sorted yet or if the adapter's underlying data has been changed since it has been sorted the last time. If not null, the order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • addSortingListener

        void addSortingListener(@NonNull
                        ListSortingListener<DataType> listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been sorted.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the class ListSortingListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeSortingListener

        void removeSortingListener(@NonNull
                           ListSortingListener<DataType> listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been sorted, anymore.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the class ListSortingListener. The listener may not be null
